page.title: 19Sir John Corbet.
page.content: The{Corbet}family have lived in the area for 1,000 years.They used to live in{Moreton Corbet Castle}which was built in{Norman}times.Later the family extended it into a more luxurious home but this was burnt down during the Civil War and is now a ruin. The Corbets then lived at Acton Reynalds,which is now a school. The present{Sir John Corbet}lives in Vincent Cottage. Sir John became a{baronet}at the age of six during the 1st world war because four of his cousins were killed. He owns 5,000 acres of land with 11 tenanted farms on it.He employs 26 men. These include farm workers, a blacksmith and a gamekeeper. The Corbet coat of arms is a gold shield with a raven on it.
